xxl.core.io.converters

Class FloatConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.io.converters.Converter<T>
      • xxl.core.io.converters.SizeConverter<T>
        • xxl.core.io.converters.FixedSizeConverter<Float>
          • xxl.core.io.converters.FloatConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class FloatConverter
extends FixedSizeConverter<Float>
    This class provides a converter that is able to read and write Float objects. In addition to the read and write methods that read or write Float objects this class contains readFloat and writeFloat methods that convert the Float object after reading or before writing it to its primitive float type.

    Example usage (1). 

       // create a byte array output stream
   
   ByteArrayOutputStream output = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
   
   // write a Float and a float value to the output stream
   
   FloatConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.write(new DataOutputStream(output), 2.7236512f);
   FloatConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.writeFloat(new DataOutputStream(output), 6.123853f);
   
   // create a byte array input stream on the output stream
   
   ByteArrayInputStream input = new ByteArrayInputStream(output.toByteArray());
   
   // read a float value and a Float from the input stream
   
   float f1 = FloatConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.readFloat(new DataInputStream(input));
   Float f2 = FloatConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.read(new DataInputStream(input));
   
   // print the value and the object
   
   System.out.println(f1);
   System.out.println(f2);
   
   // close the streams after use
   
   input.close();
   output.close();

    See Also:
    DataInput, DataOutput, IOException, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_INSTANCE

        public static final FloatConverter DEFAULT_INSTANCE
        This instance can be used for getting a default instance of a float converter. It is similar to the Singleton Design Pattern (for further details see Creational Patterns, Prototype in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides) except that there are no mechanisms to avoid the creation of other instances of a float converter.

      • SIZE

        public static final int SIZE
        This field contains the number of bytes needed to serialize the float value of a Float object. Because this size is predefined it must not be measured each time.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • FloatConverter

        public FloatConverter()
        Sole constructor. (For invocation by subclass constructors, typically implicit.)

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public Float read(DataInput dataInput,
                  Float object)
           throws IOException
        Reads the float value for the specified (Float) object from the specified data input and returns the restored object.

        This implementation ignores the specified object and returns a new Float object. So it does not matter when the specified object is null.

        Specified by:
        read in class Converter<Float>
        Parameters:
        dataInput - the stream to read the float value from in order to return a Float object.
        object - the (Float) object to be restored. In this implementation it is ignored.
        Returns:
        the read Floatcode/tt> object.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur.

      • readFloat

        public float readFloat(DataInput dataInput)
                throws IOException
        Reads the float value from the specified data input and returns it.

        This implementation uses the read method and converts the returned Float object to its primitive float type.

        Parameters:
        dataInput - the stream to read the float value from.
        Returns:
        the read float value.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O errors occur.

      • write

        public void write(DataOutput dataOutput,
                  Float object)
           throws IOException
        Writes the float value of the specified Float object to the specified data output.

        This implementation calls the writeFloat method of the data output with the float value of the object.

        Specified by:
        write in class Converter<Float>
        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the stream to write the float value of the specified Float object to.
        object - the Float object that float value should be written to the data output.
        Throws:
        IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

      • writeFloat

        public void writeFloat(DataOutput dataOutput,
                       float f)
                throws IOException
        Writes the specified float value to the specified data output.

        This implementation calls the write method with a Float object wrapping the specified float value.

        Parameters:
        dataOutput - the stream to write the specified float value to.
        f - the float value that should be written to the data output.
        Throws:
        IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.
